result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven James Gallob was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (3rd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Complete a driver assessment and safety plan.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber for work only. Good time allowed.

Courrt ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample.
Court ordered defendant to pay a $1,200.00 fine while on probation.

miscConds.notes: Undergo a mental health evaluation; follow through with any treatment recommended.

No controlled substances, other than those legally prescribed for defendant by a duly licensed physician for his mental or physical needs; take as prescribed and only for as long as deemed medically reasonable and necessary. No alcohol; urine screens.
Seek and maintain employment. Be given job and vocational training. Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.

Court ordered defendant to pay $1,200 fine, the DNA surcharge, plus costs and disbursements, as well as supervision fees. Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant which is non-dischargable in bankruptcy.

timeConds.notes: With Huber for work only. Good time allowed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven James Gallob

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1 (no effective date/DOT to figure)
Associated with Charge #1
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Steven James Gallob in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Steven James Gallob in custody.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms.  Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 20.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court, defendant Steven James Gallob not in court, in custody.  James W Frisch appeared on behalf of Kimberly D. Schoepp for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a speedy trial date, but advised the Court that his client may instead proceed with a guilty plea.  Court set the following briefing schedule: movant must file any motions by 6/05/14; response due by 6/12/14; reply due by 6/16/14.  All motions in limine, jury instructions and witness lists must be filed by 6/09/14.  Should defendant wish to proceed on the next date, defense counsel must notify the bailiffs to have defendant produced by no later than noon on Friday, 6/13/14.    Court does not object to transfer of defendant's two cases pending in Branch 17 (12CT1588 and 13CM5098) if that branch does not object.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Speedy trial demand.

Defendant Steven James Gallob in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Steven James Gallob in custody.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Case is scheduled for 5/15/14 at 1:30 p.m. to accompany new case.
Arguments heard as to bail.  Court set bail at $2,500.00 CASH with TOT to WCS; absolute sobriety; no alcohol or illegal substances; no weapons or firearms; no driving without a valid license.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court, defendant Steven James Gallob not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared on behalf of Kimberly D. Schoepp for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request of preliminary hearing date.  Court ordered case adjourned for preliminary hearing before Branch PE.  Two dates were set; defendant picked up another case (14CF1865) which is currently set for 5/15/14; however, a second date was selected in case the District Attorney's Office needs additional time to subpoena witnesses in this case.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 22, 2041 at 01:30 pm.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 5/04/14.  Bench Warrant in file.  Case is adjourned for return on bench warrant in Branch 20.Notice is given to Public Defender's Office and District Attorney.
Notice of bail/bond forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($2,000.00) ad
/from WCS, received and filed. Defendant has been discharged from the program due to non-compliance. rn
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 2000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Terese M Dick in court.  Jay Pucek for Kimberly D. Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case is called on the record at approximately 3:10 p.m. The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.

Filed, WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program Report dated 1/27/14.
css

14RM002749  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
1/21/14 vf

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Steven James Gallob in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Steven James Gallob in custody.  Michael C. Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Steven James Gallob not in court.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 01/08/2014 @ 1:30pm
